name: Basic Profile for CodeableConcept
description: Basic Profile for CodeableConcept for validation support

definition.short: Concept - reference to a terminology or just  text
definition.formal: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.
definition.comments: Not all terminology uses fit this general pattern. In some cases, models should not use CodeableConcept and use Coding directly and provide their own structure for managing text, codings, translations and the relationship between elements and pre- and post-coordination.

constraint.name: Coding.primary rule
constraint.human: Only one coding in a set can be chosen directly by the user

definition.short: Code defined by a terminology system
definition.formal: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
definition.comments: Codes may defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the v3 core principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL not be used to infer meaning.

definition.short: Plain text representation of the concept
definition.formal: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user or concept.
definition.comments: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this
